data: Funerary epitaph for Cn. Kanius Lucillianus

Three fragments of a white marble plaque, missing fragments at bottom and bottom right. Surface is polished. Rear is flat, mounted on modern mortar. At least one break in the stone occurred after modern mortar applied to rear. Green discolouration evident on two of the fragments is modern. Modern pencil has been used to fill in the letters.
Five complete lines of Latin text. Use of a triangular interpunct in line 4.

Letters are strong and clear, but do not consistently follow the line and letter heights are inconsistent. Most letters are straight, except for the 'V' in line 4 and the 'nos' in line 5. Most lines have serifs. Letters are crammed into line 3. Error in spelling 'vixit' in line 4 ('vixitit')
Found in Termini Imerese in 1880, during work carried out on a building owned by Giuseppe Catanzaro, near Porta Messina
Antoniou, 2023-07-06. In the Depositi of Museo Civico Baldassare Romano, room 1, scaffold 13, shelf 5
I.Sicily with the permission of the Assessorato Regionale dei Beni Culturali e dell’Identità Siciliana - Dipartimento dei Beni Culturali e dell’Identità Siciliana; photo J.Prag 2023-07-06.

A large and well-displayed collection. It begins with three ante-rooms, in the first of which is a rich display of lithics (mainly Neolithic) from the surrounding area. A display of material from Himera (lion-head spouts from the Temple of Victory and red-figure craters being the principle pieces) and a numismatic gallery then follow before the main room which contains Hellenistic and Roman material from Termini Imerese itself. Small finds, sculpture and inscriptions predominate. The museum collection continues upstairs with non-archaeological material (and a single inscription). The courtyard of the building holds a large collection of architectural pieces and inscriptions
Via Marco Tullio Cicerone, 90018 - Termini Imerese (PA)
Inscriptiones Bruttiorum Lucaniae Campaniae Siciliae Sardiniae Latinae. Pars posterior. Inscriptiones Siciliae et Sardiniae

T. Mommsen, Inscriptiones Bruttiorum Lucaniae Campaniae Siciliae Sardiniae Latinae. Pars posterior. Inscriptiones Siciliae et Sardiniae, Corpus Inscriptionum Latinarum, consilio et auctoritate Academiae Litterarum Regiae Borussicae editum, 10.2 (Berlin: G. Reimer, 1883)
Iscrizioni latine lapidarie del museo civico di Termini Imerese
Livia Bivona, Iscrizioni latine lapidarie del museo civico di Termini Imerese, vol. 9/8, Kokalos Supplementi / Sikelika serie storica (Palermo / Rome, 1994)

Accademia nazionale dei Lincei, Istituto nazionale di archeologia e storia dell’arte (Italy), e Reale Accademia d’Italia, «Notizie degli scavi di antichità», Notizie degli Scavi di Antichità, 1876, http://www.worldcat.org/oclc/1646037

Facsimile Images

Apparatus criticus

  • Text of autopsy

English translation

Tuuli Ahlholm

To the Shades of the Underworld. Gnaeus Kanius Lucillianus lived 38 years.

commentary

The use of 'K' rather than 'C' for Kanius, is relatively common for various nomina (e.g. Canius, Caninius). While there are other attestations of the gens Caninia in Thermae Himeraeae, see e.g. ISic000141 and ISic000167, there are no other attested members of the gens Cania in Sicily, except for a reference from Cicero (Off. 3.58).

The use of 'K' rather than 'C' for Kanius, is relatively common for various nomina (e.g. Canius, Caninius). While there are other attestations of the gens Caninia in Thermae Himeraeae, see e.g. ISic000141 and ISic000167, there are no other attested members of the gens Cania in Sicily, except for a reference from Cicero (Off. 3.58).
